column4: hey biggggg problem: apache does not have permission to do anything to my /var/www/ folder, how do I fix this, I did chown -R root:wwwusers 771 /var/www and I just want to add apache to have the ability to access this folder
any body, help
try sudo chown -R www-data.www-data /var/www
will that messup my previous permission setup or will it just add apache to the owners
it makes apache the owner
yes but I also need the group wwwusers to have permission to it as well
Starnestommy??
files can only be owned by one user and one group at a time
can I have it owned by the group wwwusers
and just put www-data user in the group wwwusers
the standard way to do it is owned by www-data
but you can add users to that group
how would I make a whole group the owner
because www-data is a member of the wwwusers group
so if I just made the wwwusers group the owner Starnestommy then it should work right?
is that posible thorugh Starnestommy
it should
how would I go abut making the wwwusers group the owner of /var/www
sudo chgrp -R wwwusers /var/www
or sudo chown -R www-data.wwwusers /var/www
